briefdescription.para: initialize libusb; Behavior differs depending on libusb version

detaileddescription.para: libusb-0.12
Probe busses and devices. The argument is ignored and defaults to NULL. Safe to call more than once.
libusb-1.0
If an location to a libusb_context is passed in, create and write in the new context. If no argument is provided, initialize libusb with the default (NULL) context.
Generally not safe to call more than once with non-NULL argument since a new context will be created each time.
libusb-0.1: No effect
libusb-1.0: Deinitialize context ctx

briefdescription.para: locate Nth (zero based) USRP device in system. Return pointer or 0 if not found.

detaileddescription.para: The following kinds of devices are considered USRPs:
unconfigured USRP (no firwmare loaded) configured USRP (firmware loaded) unconfigured Cypress FX2 (only if fx2_ok_p is true)

briefdescription.para: given a libusb_device return an instance of the appropriate libusb_device_handle

detaileddescription.para: These routines claim the specified interface and select the correct alternate interface. (USB nomenclature is totally screwed!)
If interface can't be opened, or is already claimed by some other process, 0 is returned.

briefdescription.para: load intel hex format file into USRP/Cypress FX2 (8051).

detaileddescription.para: The filename extension is typically *.ihx
Note that loading firmware may cause the device to renumerate. I.e., change its configuration, invalidating the current device handle.

memberdef.argsstring: (int nth, const char *filename, bool force, libusb_context *ctx=NULL)
memberdef.name: usrp_load_firmware_nth

briefdescription.para: load intel hex format file into USRP FX2 (8051).

detaileddescription.para: The filename extension is typically *.ihx

Note that loading firmware may cause the device to renumerate. I.e., change its configuration, invalidating the current device handle. If the result is ULS_OK, usrp_load_firmware_nth delays 1 second then rescans the busses and devices.

memberdef.argsstring: (int nth, bool force, const std::string fpga_filename="", const std::string firmware_filename="", libusb_context *ctx=NULL)
memberdef.name: usrp_load_standard_bits

briefdescription.para: load the regular firmware and fpga bitstream in the Nth USRP.

detaileddescription.para: This is the normal starting point...

memberdef.argsstring: (libusb_device_handle *udh, int which, const unsigned char hash[USRP_HASH_SIZE])
memberdef.name: usrp_set_hash

briefdescription.para: copy the given hash into the USRP hash slot which. The usrp implements two hash slots, 0 and 1.
retrieve the hash from the USRP hash slot which. The usrp implements two hash slots, 0 and 1.

memberdef.argsstring: (libusb_device_handle *udh, int which_codec, const unsigned char *buf, int len)

detaileddescription.para: buf contains alternating register_number, register_value pairs. len must be even and is the length of buf in bytes.

briefdescription.para: write specified regs to all 9862's in the system

memberdef.argsstring: (libusb_device_handle *udh, int i2c_addr, int eeprom_offset, const void *buf, int len)
memberdef.name: usrp_eeprom_write

memberdef.argsstring: (libusb_device_handle *udh, int i2c_addr, int eeprom_offset, void *buf, int len)
memberdef.name: usrp_eeprom_read

memberdef.argsstring: (libusb_device_handle *uhd, int slot, int which_dac, int value)
memberdef.name: usrp_write_aux_dac

briefdescription.para: write to the specified aux dac.

detaileddescription.para: slot: which Tx or Rx slot to write. N.B., SLOT_TX_A and SLOT_RX_A share the same AUX DAC's SLOT_TX_B and SLOT_RX_B share the same AUX DAC's
which_dac: [0,3] RX slots must use only 0 and 1. TX slots must use only 2 and 3.
AUX DAC 3 is really the 9862 sigma delta output.
value to write to aux dac. All dacs take straight binary values. Although dacs 0, 1 and 2 are 8-bit and dac 3 is 12-bit, the interface is in terms of 12-bit values [0,4095]
slot: which Tx or Rx slot to read aux dac which_adc: [0,1] which of the two adcs to read *value: return value, 12-bit straight binary.

briefdescription.para: usrp daughterboard id to name mapping
Read and return parsed daughterboard eeprom.

memberdef.argsstring: (libusb_device_handle *udh, int slot_id, short offset0, short offset1)
memberdef.name: usrp_write_dboard_offsets

briefdescription.para: write ADC/DAC offset calibration constants to d'board eeprom

detaileddescription.para:
Note that this only works on a configured usrp.
non-zero length string iff successful.
